oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Peter PB Alcoa: fieldnotes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Peter Primitive Baptist Church, Alcoa
Fieldnotes of St. Peter PB Church in Alcoa. Notes document the church's location on Howe Street and provide a brief description of the building.

Established in 1918, St. Peter Primitive Baptist Church has endured several building phases. The current building dates from 1954 and features a back expansion from 1966. Charles M. Hall School, constructed originally in 1926, once sat across the street from the church. The historic school has been adaptively reused and is now the Alcoa City Center. At the time of fieldwork, A.C. Dix served as pastor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
field notes
